bio: One of the most influential and celebrated Asian-American artists of the 20th century, Tyrus Wong (1910—2016) was a real Renaissance man: an illustrator, painter, animator, calligrapher, muralist, ceramicist, lithographer, kite maker, movie set designer, and storyboard artist. After working on some of the iconic Disney and Warner Brothers pictures, he retired from the movie industry in the late 60s to focus on his work as a kite artist. Tyrus Wong continued to paint, sketch, and design ceramics well into his 90s.
